net.rem.regression

Interface RMRemoteTask

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.hudup.core.alg.AlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.data.Exportable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultipleRM, MultipleRMRemote, MultipleRMRemoteTask, REM, REMRemote, REMRemoteTask, RM, RMRemote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMixtureREM, DefaultMixtureREM, DefaultMixtureREM.REMExt, DefaultMixtureRM, MultipleRMAbstract, REMAbstract, REMImpl, REMPrior, RMAbstract, RMRemoteWrapper, SemiMixtureREM

    public interface RMRemoteTask
extends net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgRemoteTask
    This interface declares methods for remote regression algorithm.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • R_INDICES_FIELD

        static final java.lang.String R_INDICES_FIELD
        Name of regression indices field.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • R_INDICES_DEFAULT

        static final java.lang.String R_INDICES_DEFAULT
        Default regression indices field. Each index can be number, field name, or mathematical expression. If index is number, it starts with 1 because number index 0 always points to 1 value. Number index -1 points to nothing. The pattern is {1, 2}, {#x3, 4, 5}, {x5, 6}, {log(x5), 6, 7, 8}, {#x9^#x10, 10}. The pattern can also be 1, 2, #x3+#x4, 5, x6, 7, 8, log(x9), #y^2. However, it is impossible to specify 1^2, log(1) but it is possible to specify log(x1), x2.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • note

        static final java.lang.String note
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAR_INDEX_SPECIAL_CHAR

        static final java.lang.String VAR_INDEX_SPECIAL_CHAR
        Special character for indexing variables.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • extractResponseValue

        java.lang.Object extractResponseValue(java.lang.Object input)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Extracting value of response variable (Z) from specified profile. In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is focused.
        Parameters:
        input - specified input. It is often profile but it can be an array of real values.
        Returns:
        value of response variable (Z) extracted from specified profile.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • executeByXStatistic

        double executeByXStatistic(double[] xStatistic)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Executing by X statistics.
        Parameters:
        xStatistic - X statistics (regressors). The first element of this X statistics is 1.
        Returns:
        result of execution. Return null if execution is failed.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • extractRegressor

        VarWrapper extractRegressor(int index)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Extracting regressor (X). In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is focused.
        Parameters:
        index - specified index. Index 0 is not included in the profile because this specified index is in the parameter r_indices. So the index here is the second index, and of course it is number. Index starts from 1. So index 0 always indicates to null.
        Returns:
        regressor (X) extracted.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • extractRegressors

        java.util.List<VarWrapper> extractRegressors()
                                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Getting list of regressors. In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is focused.
        Returns:
        list of regressors.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

        java.util.List<VarWrapper> extractSingleRegressors()

        Getting list of single regressors which are attribute names.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • extractRegressorValue

        double extractRegressorValue(java.lang.Object input,
                             int index)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Extracting value of regressor (X) from specified profile. In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is focused.
        Parameters:
        input - specified input. It is often profile. It can be an array of real values.
        index - specified index. Index 0 is not included in the profile because this specified index is in the parameter r_indices. So the index here is the second index, and of course it is number. Index starts from 1. So index 0 always indicates to value 1.
        Returns:
        value of regressor (X) extracted from specified profile.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • transformResponse

        java.lang.Object transformResponse(java.lang.Object z,
                                   boolean inverse)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Transforming independent variable Z. In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is not focused but is useful in some cases.
        Parameters:
        z - specified variable Z.
        inverse - if true, there is an inverse transformation.
        Returns:
        transformed value of Z.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.
